body:
I'm not able to reproduce this. Can you check `Get-PackageProvider` as well? 

(My $PSVersionTable, for comparison:)
```
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17758
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

This is the result of: Get-PackageProvider
```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-PackageProvider

Name                     Version          DynamicOptions
----                     -------          --------------
NuGet                    2.8.5.210        Destination, ExcludeVersion, Scope, SkipDependencies, Headers, FilterOnTag, Contains, AllowPrereleaseVersions, ConfigFile, SkipValidate
PowerShellGet            1.6.7.0          PackageManagementProvider, Type, Scope, AllowClobber, SkipPublisherCheck, InstallUpdate, NoPathUpdate, AllowPrereleaseVersions, Filter...
```

Do you have any modules installed? My output for this command isn't showing the "core" module set, but it is showing third party modules. Not sure if that's the issue or just tangential:
```
PS C:\Users\Joel> get-package

Name                           Version          Source                           ProviderName
----                           -------          ------                           ------------
IconExport                     2.0.0            https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
Pester                         4.3.1            https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
AdvancedHistory                1.0.2            https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
oh-my-posh                     2.0.207          https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
posh-git                       0.7.3            https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
PSKoans                        0.41.0           https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
PSReadLine                     2.0.0-beta2      https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
```

If you execute `Get-Package` in Windows PowerShell, you could see
```

Name                     Version          DynamicOptions                                                                                                                                       
----                     -------          --------------                                                                                                                                       
msi                      3.0.0.0          AdditionalArguments                                                                                                                                  
msu                      3.0.0.0                                                                                                                                                               
NuGet                    2.8.5.208        Destination, ExcludeVersion, Scope, SkipDependencies, Headers, FilterOnTag, Contains, AllowPrereleaseVersions, ConfigFile, SkipValidate              
PowerShellGet            1.0.0.1          PackageManagementProvider, Type, Scope, AllowClobber, SkipPublisherCheck, InstallUpdate, NoPathUpdate, Filter, Tag, Includes, DscResource, RoleCap...
Programs                 3.0.0.0          IncludeWindowsInstaller, IncludeSystemComponent                                                                                                      
```
IMO, PSCore doesn't supports msu, msi and programs package provider(as of now). Hence Packages installed by other providers, here nuget and PowerShellGet only shown.

And yes, here in 6.1.0 `Get-Package` understands modules installed by PackageManagement only at `C:\Program Files\PowerShell\Modules`

These are my results:

- Windows Powershell
```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-Package

Name                           Version          Source                           ProviderName
----                           -------          ------                           ------------
7-Zip 18.05 (x64)              18.05                                             Programs
Adblock Plus for IE (32-bit... 1.6                                               msi
Oracle VM VirtualBox 5.2.18    5.2.18                                            msi
Java 10.0.2 (64-bit)           10.0.2.0         C:\Program Files\Java\jre-10.... msi
CCleaner                       5.47                                              Programs
Java(TM) SE Development Kit... 10.0.2.0         C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-10.... msi
PowerShell 6-x64               6.1.0.0                                           msi
Java Auto Updater              10.0.2.0                                          msi
VLC media player               3.0.4                                             Programs
NVIDIA 3D Vision Driver 391.33 391.33                                            Programs
NVIDIA Graphics Driver 391.33  391.33                                            Programs
NVIDIA nView 148.92            148.92                                            Programs
NVIDIA WMI 2.31.0              2.31.0                                            Programs
NVIDIA HD Audio Driver 1.3.... 1.3.36.6                                          Programs
B4A v8.50                                                                        Programs
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
2018-09 Cumulative Update f...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
2018-09 Cumulative Update f...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
Definition Update for Windo...                                                   msu
PackageManagement              1.1.7.0          https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
PowerShellGet                  1.6.0            https://www.powershellgallery... PowerShellGet
```

Now pay attention to this, in the list above I have for example CCleaner installed and the results are different, see below:

- Windows Powershell

```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-Package CCleaner

Name                           Version          Source                           ProviderName
----                           -------          ------                           ------------
CCleaner                       5.47                                              Programs
```
- Powershell Core

```powershell
PS C:\WINDOWS\system32> Get-Package CCleaner
Get-Package : No package found for 'CCleaner'.
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Package CCleaner
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Microsoft.Power...lets.GetPackage:GetPackage) [Get-Package], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : NoMatchFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.GetPackage
```
I believe, because `Programs` package provider is not supported by PSCore.

Hi all,

Has there been any progress on this issue? Alternatively, can someone confirm @kvprasoon's reason for the issue, and/or recommend some workarounds?

Many thanks.
